protocol_name: Cas9 RNP nucleofection for cell lines using Lonza 4D Nucleofector
protocol_name_html: Cas9 RNP nucleofection for cell lines using Lonza 4D Nucleofector
description:
This protocol, based on published work, demonstrates how to delivery Cas9 RNP-based gene editing reagents to cultured mamallian cells by electroporation with a Lonza 4d Nucleofector. Consider consulting some of the following papers:

 

1. RNP delivery paper upon which this work is based (Open Access):

https://elifesciences.org/content/3/e04766

2. Paper by an IGI post-doc that details the rationale behind HDR donor design:

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/26789497
before_start:
You will need the following materials:

 

1. Purified Cas9 NLS protein, 40 µM

2. Purified sgRNA from in vitro transcription, >25 µM

3. single-stranded DNA HDR donor, 100 µM (as an IDT Ultramer)

4. Lonza 4d Nucleofector with X Unit

5. Lonza 'S' kit: electroporation solution and 16 reaction small-sized cuvettes

components.data: Bring 100 pmol of Cas9 to a final volume of 5 µL using Cas9 buffer (20 mM HEPES-KOH pH 7.5, 150 mM KCl, 10% glycerol, 1 mM TCEP). For 40 µM stock: 2.5 µL.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Bring 100 pmol of Cas9 to a final volume of 5 µL using Cas9 buffer (20 mM HEPES-KOH pH 7.5, 150 mM KCl, 10% glycerol, 1 mM TCEP). For 40 µM stock: 2.5 µL.

source_data.annotation: Preparing RNP mix notes: Cas9-NLS is stored in -80oC, sgRNAs are prepped by runoff transcription, Cas9 buffer is kept in the TC hood and must be kept sterile. TCEP is optional for same-day application.

source_data.guidelines:
The primers used are: one long, variable oligo that carries the T7 promoter and desired guide sequence; an 82-nt constant oligo that carries the 3' end of the sgRNA; two short external primers for amplification.

Assembly Oligos:
T7FwdVar:
GGATCCTAATACGACTCACTATAG---guide-sequence---GTTTTAGAGCTAGAA
T7RevLong: AAAAAAGCACCGACTCGGTGCCACTTTTTCAAGTTGATAACGGACTAGCCTTATTTTAACTTGCTATTTCTAGCTCTAAAAC

Amplification Primers:
T7FwdAmp: GGATCCTAATACGACTCACTATAG
T7RevAmp: AAAAAAGCACCGACTCGG

Designing the guide sequence:The T7 transcript starts with the G before the dashes in the Fwd assembly oligo. If your target calls for a G at the 5’ end of the guide, use the one already included in T7FwdVar design. If your target calls for a different base at the 5’ end, put the whole guide sequence in T7FwdVar; there will be an extra G on the end that should have minimal effect, unless your guide is quite short.
Making the template: we have used the Phusion-HF DNA polymerase. Although the amplification primers have quite different Tm’s, they work together fine.

components.data:
Add the desired protospacer sequence to the T7FwdVar oligo and order the oligo from your favorite oligonucleotide supplier. There are many programs available for protospacer design that attempt to optimize on- and/or off-target activity. Which program is most useful depends upon many factors including type of editing, organism being edited, etc. Choice of protospacer design program is beyond the scope of this protocol.

 

The transcript will start with the bolded G just 5’ of the dashes in the T7FwdVar oligo. T7 RNA polymerase requires a 5’ G for proper transcript initiation. If your protospacer has a G at the 5’ end, you can omit it from the T7FwdVar design to avoid duplication of the G. If your protospacer has a C, T, or A at the 5’ end, add the whole protospacer sequence to T7FwdVar. In this case, there will be an extra G added to the 5’ end of the protospacer, but literature indicates this will have minimal effect unless your guide is very short.

 

Primers: 

T7FwdVar oligo (5’-GGATCCTAATACGACTCACTATAG--protospacer sequence—GTTTTAGAGCTAGAA-3’ )
T7RevLong oligo (5’-AAAAAAGCACCGACTCGGTGCCACTTTTTCAAGTTGATAACGGACTAGCCTTATTTTAACTTGCTATTTCTAGCTCTAAAAC-3’ )
T7FwdAmp primer (5’-GGATCCTAATACGACTCACTATAG-3’)
T7RevAmp primer (5’-AAAAAAGCACCGACTCGG-3’ )
components.name: Description

There are many programs available for protospacer design that attempt to optimize on- and/or off-target activity. Which program is most useful depends upon many factors including type of editing, organism being edited, etc. Choice of protospacer design program is beyond the scope of this protocol.

 

The transcript will start with the bolded G just 5’ of the dashes in the T7FwdVar oligo. T7 RNA polymerase requires a 5’ G for proper transcript initiation. If your protospacer has a G at the 5’ end, you can omit it from the T7FwdVar design to avoid duplication of the G. If your protospacer has a C, T, or A at the 5’ end, add the whole protospacer sequence to T7FwdVar. In this case, there will be an extra G added to the 5’ end of the protospacer, but literature indicates this will have minimal effect unless your guide is very short.

 

Primers: 

T7FwdVar oligo (5’-GGATCCTAATACGACTCACTATAG--protospacer sequence—GTTTTAGAGCTAGAA-3’ )
T7RevLong oligo (5’-AAAAAAGCACCGACTCGGTGCCACTTTTTCAAGTTGATAACGGACTAGCCTTATTTTAACTTGCTATTTCTAGCTCTAAAAC-3’ )
T7FwdAmp primer (5’-GGATCCTAATACGACTCACTATAG-3’)
T7RevAmp primer (5’-AAAAAAGCACCGACTCGG-3’ )

components.data: Design sgRNA and order PCR oligos.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Design sgRNA and order PCR oligos.

components.data:
For each T7FwdVar oligo you designed, set up the following PCR (total volume should be 20.0 µL). Make sure everything is RNase free and filter tips are used. Furthermore, whipe down everything (in every step of protocol) with RNase Away to ensure no contamination. 

 

13.4 µl DEPC-treated H2O
4.0 uL 5x Phusion HF Buffer                                       
0.8 µl 10 mM dNTPs                     
0.4 µl T7FwdVar (1 µM)     
0.4 µl T7RevLong (1 µM)    
0.4 µl T7FwdAmp (100 µM)             
0.4 µl T7RevAmp (100 µM)              
0.2 µl Phusion HF DNA polymerase (2u/µl)

 

If making multiple sgRNA templates, prepare a master mix with all components except T7FwdVar. Include a no template control (omit T7FwdVar).

 

Primers: 

T7FwdVar oligo (5’-GGATCCTAATACGACTCACTATAG--protospacer sequence—GTTTTAGAGCTAGAA-3’ )
T7RevLong oligo (5’-AAAAAAGCACCGACTCGGTGCCACTTTTTCAAGTTGATAACGGACTAGCCTTATTTTAACTTGCTATTTCTAGCTCTAAAAC-3’ )
T7FwdAmp primer (5’-GGATCCTAATACGACTCACTATAG-3’)
T7RevAmp primer (5’-AAAAAAGCACCGACTCGG-3’ )

source_data.section: Making in vitro transcription DNA template

components.data:
Run PCR:
95˚ 30 sec
95˚ 10 sec
57˚ 10 sec  
72˚ 10 sec
      34x steps 2-4
72˚ 2 min
4˚ hold


No PCR cleanup necessary at this point

components.data:
Mix the following to make 20 µl total T7 transcription mix

volume reagent
2 µl 10x Buffer 1x
2 µl ATP (100 mM), 10 mM
2 µl GTP (100 mM), 10 mM
2 µl CTP (100 mM), 10 mM
2 µl UTP (100 mM), 10 mM
8 µl DNA template 
2 µl T7 RNA polymerase mix
components.name: Description

2 µl CTP (100 mM), 10 mM
2 µl UTP (100 mM), 10 mM
8 µl DNA template 
2 µl T7 RNA polymerase mix

components.data: Prepare Cells
components.name: Section

components.data: Spin 100 x g for 10 minutes to pellet cells softly. While the cells are spinning, prepare plate and cuvette.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin 100 x g for 10 minutes to pellet cells softly. While the cells are spinning, prepare plate and cuvette.

components.data: Prepare Cells
components.name: Section

components.data: Prepare Cells
components.name: Section

components.data: Prepare and label wells on 20uL nucleofection strips. Configure Lonza 4d using recommended cell-type program.

components.data: Nucleofection

source_data.reagent_name: SF Cell Line 4D-Nucleofector® X Kit S (32 RCT)

components.data: Pipette off media from cells, gently but completely, using a P200. The pellet is very soft so be careful.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipette off media from cells, gently but completely, using a P200. The pellet is very soft so be careful.

components.data: Resuspend cells in 20 µL of nucleofector solution using a P200.

components.name: Section

components.data: Nucleofection
components.name: Section

source_data.annotation:
Design the donor to match the guide, according to our NBT paper:

 

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/26789497

 

We order single-stranded donors from IDT, as "Ultramers" and resuspend them to 100 µM final concentration.
source_data.thread_text:
Design the donor to match the guide, according to our NBT paper:

 

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/26789497

 

We order single-stranded donors from IDT, as "Ultramers" and resuspend them to 100 µM final concentration.
source_data.body:
Design the donor to match the guide, according to our NBT paper:

 

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/26789497

 

We order single-stranded donors from IDT, as "Ultramers" and resuspend them to 100 µM final concentration.

components.data: Add nucleofection mixes to the multiwell cuvette, and cap. Pay attention to the orientation of the cap and cuvette in the nucleofector, which is noted in the manufacturer’s instructions.
components.name: Description

components.data: Allow cells to sit in nucleofection strips for 10 minutes post-nucleofection. This is supposed to increase efficiency.
components.name: Description

components.data: Nucleofection
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 80uL of pre-warmed media to each well.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 80uL of pre-warmed media to each well.

components.data: Nucleofection
components.name: Section

components.data: Pipette mixture out with a P200 into your pre-warmed 12-well plate. This should get the vast majority of cells, but if you wish, you may wash out the rest with media from the same well, chemistry-style.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipette mixture out with a P200 into your pre-warmed 12-well plate. This should get the vast majority of cells, but if you wish, you may wash out the rest with media from the same well, chemistry-style.

components.data: Nucleofection
components.name: Section

components.data: Allow cells 24 hours to settle and recover before attempted downstream analysis. Consider including un-zapped controls to test viability.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Allow cells 24 hours to settle and recover before attempted downstream analysis. Consider including un-zapped controls to test viability.

components.data: Nucleofection
components.name: Section
